intro: Kaukenia subsericea, commonly known as the velvetleaf kaukenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded understories of forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
